excerpt: This 107-m. tower has an observatory with views of mountains & the star-shaped fort below.
detail_description: Goryōkaku Tower, standing at 107 meters tall, features an observatory offering stunning views of the star-shaped fort below and the surrounding mountains. The fortress was strategically designed to accommodate more gun turrets and minimize blind spots along its walls. Visitors can take a lift to the observation deck for panoramic vistas before exploring other nearby attractions such as Mount Hakodate, Hakodate Morning Market, and Onuma Quasi-National Park.
name: Goryōkaku Tower

excerpt: Quaint shopping mall in a circa-1869 warehouse complex, with restuarants, groceries & gifts.
detail_description: Discover a charming shopping destination with a rich history at the Kanemori Red Brick Warehouse in Hakodate. This circa-1869 warehouse complex has been transformed into a bustling commercial district, offering an array of shops where you can find local snacks, sweets, and unique clothing and accessories. As one of the first ports in Japan to open to foreign trade, Hakodate boasts a long commercial history, and the red brick warehouses along the bay serve as a testament to this legacy.
name: Kanemori Red Brick Warehouse

excerpt: Accessible via cable car or hiking trail, this 1,096-ft. mount is a popular lookout for city lights.
detail_description: Mount Hakodate, standing at 1,096 feet tall, is a popular spot for taking in stunning city views. Accessible by cable car or hiking trail, it offers a breathtaking panorama of the city lights below. The area also holds historical significance as a cemetery for foreigners with Western religious beliefs dating back to the late 19th century.
name: Mount Hakodate

excerpt: Cosmopolitan shopping street with international brands & boutiques, personal services & dining.
detail_description: Motomachi is a cosmopolitan shopping street featuring international brands, boutiques, personal services, and dining options. The district boasts Western-style architecture from the late nineteenth century, giving it a San Francisco vibe. Visitors can explore various churches in the area, including the striking white Russian Orthodox Church with green copper-clad onion domes and spires.
name: Motomachi

excerpt: Forested park with hiking & cycling trails, campsites, a dormant volcano & boating on several lakes.
detail_description: Onuma Quasi-National Park, located just 20 kilometers north of Hakodate, is a picturesque forested park known for its island-dotted lakes and the majestic dormant volcano, Mount Komagatake. The park offers hiking and cycling trails, campsites, and boating opportunities on several lakes. It's easily accessible from Hakodate or Sapporo via limited express trains that stop at Onuma Koen Station.
name: Onuma National Park

detail_description: The Hakodate Morning Market, also known as Asaichi, is a must-visit attraction in Hakodate. Located near the main train station, it opens daily from 6:00 AM to 12:00 PM. This market mainly offers a variety of fresh fish and seafood. Despite Japan's love for fish, this market stands out as the first fish market visited by many due to its smaller and more approachable atmosphere compared to the bustling Tokyo markets.
name: Hakodate Morning Market Ekini Market

excerpt: The Yunokawa Onsen is a well known onsen in Japan on the northern island of Hokkaidō. It is located on the outskirts of Hakodate city close to Hakodate Airport. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Yunokawa Onsen is a renowned hot spring destination located on the outskirts of Hakodate city in Hokkaido, Japan. It is conveniently close to Hakodate Airport and offers a string of hot springs along the coast, with public foot baths scattered throughout the area. Visitors can also explore the Hakodate Tropical Botanical Garden, home to 3,000 exotic plant species and famous for its hot-tubbing monkeys enjoying mineral baths.
name: Yunokawa Onsen

excerpt: Moated, star-shaped 1800s fort, now a leafy park with picnic areas & spring cherry blossom viewing.
detail_description: Goryokaku Park, located in the center of Hakodate city, is a former 1800s fort that has been transformed into a picturesque park with picnic areas and an abundance of cherry blossom trees. The park's star-shaped design holds historical significance as it was the site of the final battle between the old Shogunate army and the newly formed government forces. Visitors can explore restored ancient buildings within its premises, such as the Hakodate Magistrate's Office.
name: Goryokaku Park

excerpt: Hakodate is one of the main cities on Hokkaido, Japan's northernmost island. Looming over the town is 334m-high Mount Hakodate. The mountain's summit, reachable by aerial ropeway gondola, offers dramatic nighttime views. At its base is Motomachi, a neighborhood of steep streets with Western-style, early-20th-century buildings. A city landmark is the grand Old Public Hall of Hakodate Ward, built in 1910.
detail_description: Hakodate, located on Hokkaido, Japan's northernmost island, is a city known for its stunning attractions and sights. The 334m-high Mount Hakodate offers dramatic nighttime views from its summit, accessible by aerial ropeway gondola. The neighborhood of Motomachi features steep streets with early-20th-century Western-style buildings. A notable landmark is the grand Old Public Hall of Hakodate Ward, built in 1910.
name: Hakodate

excerpt: Park with cherry trees in a late-Edo period, 5-pointed star-shaped fortress with a moat.
detail_description: Goryōkaku is a late-Edo period fortress located in Hakodate, Japan. The star-shaped fort was built to defend Hokkaido against potential Russian attacks and was later used in a significant battle during the Meiji Restoration of 1869. Today, the park surrounding Goryōkaku is known for its beautiful cherry blossoms, making it a popular destination for visitors. Additionally, the night view from Mt.
name: Goryōkaku

detail_description: Hakodate Morning Market Square is a bustling hub of activity from the early hours, making it an ideal spot for a delightful morning experience. Divided into several sections, this market near Hakodate Station offers a wide array of local breakfast options and takeout meals. Additionally, during the first six days of August, the area around the port comes alive with food stalls and vibrant festivities during the Hakodate port festival.
name: Hakodate Morning Market Square

excerpt: Renovated civic building from 1910, with a period interior & harbor views from its balcony.
detail_description: The Old Public Hall of Hakodate Ward is a beautifully renovated civic building dating back to 1910, showcasing elegant Western-style architecture influenced by the city's exposure to Western trade. This historical landmark offers stunning harbor views from its balcony and features a period interior that exudes the grandeur of European monarchs' palaces. Designated as a national important cultural property, the light yellow and light blue exterior adds to its charm.
name: Old Public Hall of Hakodate Ward
address: 旧函館区公会堂内, 11-13 Motomachi, Hakodate, Hokkaido 040-0054, Japan

excerpt: Small, historic Roman Catholic church featuring Gothic architecture & a bell tower.
detail_description: Catholic Church Hakodate Motomachi is a small, historic church known for its Gothic architecture and bell tower. The compact port city of Hakodate offers various attractions such as Victorian-era mansions in the Motomachi district, waterfront Beer Halls, Mount Hakodate ropeway, and Yunokawa Onsen. Visitors can explore the area by taking the Hakodate tram to Jujigai and strolling through historical churches and Western-style buildings like the Motomachi Roman Catholic Church.
name: Catholic Church Hakodate Motomachi
address: 元町教会, 15-30 Motomachi, Hakodate, Hokkaido 040-0054, Japan

detail_description: Hachiman-Zaka Slope is a renowned attraction in Hakodate, known for its steep incline and stunning vistas. Named after the nearby Hakodate Hachiman Shrine, this stone-paved street is flanked by trees and offers panoramic views of the Hakodate Bay area and the distant Mashu Maru. Among the 19 sloping streets in Hakodate, Hachiman-Zaka is considered the most picturesque as it descends from Mount Hakodate to Hakodate Bay.
name: Hachiman-Zaka Slope

detail_description: Tea Shop Yūhi is a traditional teahouse located in Hakodate, offering matcha and wagashi while overlooking the ocean from its historic wooden building. The shop is housed in a converted 19th-century quarantine station and features an antique collection, including a German Polyphon music box. With its cozy atmosphere and scenic views of Hakodate Harbor, it provides an authentic Japanese tea experience.
name: Tea Shop Yūhi

detail_description: Hakodate Station is a bustling hub for travelers, offering easy access to local attractions and transportation options. Nearby, visitors can savor the renowned dancing squid at Tabiji or explore the vibrant Daimon Yokocho with its array of street stalls serving up squid ramen and seafood-packed donburi rice bowls. The Hakodate morning market is a must-visit, brimming with fresh seafood until noon.
name: Hakodate Station

excerpt: Landscaped park with a tea-room garden, an artificial stream & a greenhouse, plus lawns for sports.
detail_description: This park is located in the municipality of Hirakawa-shi, near the city of Sapporo. The garden was first established as an Iwafune Garden in the early 20th century, and has since been expanded to include a tea-room garden, artificial stream and greenhouse. The park also includes lawns for sports.
name: Miharashi Park

excerpt: Tropical botanical garden featuring an airy greenhouse & monkeys bathing in a hot spring.
detail_description: Hakodate Tropical Botanical Garden is a must-visit destination near Yunokawa Hot Spring Resort. The garden features an airy greenhouse and is famous for its unique attraction - monkeys bathing in a hot spring to weather out the cold winter. This sight has become popular among visitors, offering an interesting experience. The clever Japanese macaques have learned to ward off the biting cold by soaking in the hot springs, creating a fascinating spectacle for tourists.
name: Hakodate Tropical Botanical Garden

excerpt: Cable car boarding & disembarking point for a modern tramway to the top of Mount Hakodate.
detail_description: The Mt. Hakodate Ropeway, also known as the Mountain Base Station, is a modern tramway that takes passengers up to the top of Mount Hakodate, a 334-meter-high inactive volcanic mountain. The gondola can accommodate up to 125 people and offers a quick 3-minute journey to the summit, providing stunning panoramic views of the city, port, and beaches below.
name: Mt. Hakodate Ropeway - Mountain Base Station

excerpt: History exhibits shown in a restored Edo-period government structure with traditional architecture.
detail_description: The Hakodate Magistrate's Office is a restored Edo-period government building located in the center of Goryokaku. Originally constructed in 1864 at the foot of Mount Hakodate, it was later moved to its current location. After being dismantled following Japan's last civil war, the office was reconstructed from 2006 to 2010 and now stands as a charming rust-colored structure within Goryokaku Park.
name: Hakodate Magistrate's Office
